snippet: In “Saving Normal,” and “Book of Woe,” a psychiatrist and psychotherapist caution against a surfeit of diagnoses in their profession’s ever-expanding official manual.
abstract: Dwight Garner reviews books The Book of Woe: The DSM and the Unmaking of Psychiatry by Gary Greenberg and Saving Normal: An Insider's Revolt Against Out-of-Control Psychiatric Diagnosis, DSM-5, Big Pharma, and the Medicalization of Ordinary Life by Allen Frances.
lead_paragraph: In “Saving Normal,” and “Book of Woe,” a psychiatrist and psychotherapist caution against a surfeit of diagnoses in their profession’s ever-expanding official manual.

headline.seo: Greenberg’s ‘Book of Woe’ and Frances’s ‘Saving Normal’
headline.main: Two Pleas for Sanity in Judging Saneness
headline.print_headline: Two Pleas For Sanity In Judging Saneness

keywords.value: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (Book)
keywords.name: creative_works
